column4: Question: I've set AllowRootLogin to no in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file on my host computer, yet when I do ssh root@mydomain.com from my client system, it still asks for the password for the root user. Is this the normal behavior?
Shouldn't it say that the user doesn't exist or something?
The root user exists. NEVER use root for ssh.
It IS disabled, since root has no password set at all.
